message_1: A company has 5 employees and they need to form a team of 3 members to work on a project. In how many ways can they form different teams?
message_2:
To form a team of 3 members from 5 employees, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of employees (5 in this case), k is the number of members in the team (3 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function.

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!(5-3)!)

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!2!)

C(5, 3) = (5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(2 × 1))

C(5, 3) = (120) / (6 × 2)

C(5, 3) = 120 / 12

C(5, 3) = 10

So, there are 10 different ways to form a team of 3 members from 5 employees.
